system.description:
Your studies have finally born full fruit, marking you as a near peerless prodigy of arcane technique with the following benefits:

  • You may cast the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.zc250942nlox9vyk]{Counterspell} and @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.hms9kdl2qoqjjrs4]{Dispel Magic} spells each at 3rd level once per short or long rest without expending a spell slot.  If you have access to third level spell slots, you may also cast them using those, treating them as wizard spells that are always prepared and do not count against your number of prepared spells, even if your wizard level would not normally be high enough to know 3rd level spells.  When you cast either spell, you may make an arcana using intelligence rather than a straight intelligence check when targeting spells of the appropriate level, applying the spellcraft specialty if you have it.
  • You may choose a number of wizard or scholar spells you know equal to your intelligence modifier.  You may choose a rare version of those spells to learn.  These may either be existing rare spells or, with narrator permission, you may design your own using the spellcraft rules.  In this latter case, you should only apply one modification per rare spell.  If your intelligence modifier later increases, you may select another spell to apply this benefit to.
